title: How Dagny's luminous pop battles Norway's endless nights
description: The singer spends two months a year in darkness, but you wouldn't know it from her music.

title: N-word: The troubled history of the racial slur
description: The term can be traced back to slavery and to many it's one of the most offensive words out there.

title: 'Why I’m not alone in missing hugs during the pandemic'
description: What does touch mean to us and how has the need for touch changed because of Covid-19?

title: 'We can't let her down again: We have to find her'
description: After being taken hostage by the so-called Islamic State in 2013, no one knows for certain what happened to American aid worker Kayla Mueller.

title: The Electoral College: Which voters really decide the US election?
description: More than 245 million Americans are eligible to vote but only a few will decide the outcome.

title: Trump in hospital: 'We're here to tell him that we love him'
description: One couple among hundreds of Trump fans outside the hospital say they travelled all the way from Arizona.

title: 'Shopping around is impossible when you don't have a computer'
description: Loyal insurance, phone and savings customers see costs rise each year, and some have no access to cheaper deals.

title: What is the Good Friday Agreement?
description: Why a two-decade-old deal to keep the peace in Northern Ireland matters so much.

title: US election 2020: 'Trump's done what he said he would for business'
description: The US is facing its sharpest economic downturn in decades - but it's not hurting President Trump.

title: The woman who wants everyone to get a pension
description: Romi Savova is the founder and chief executive of pension firm PensionBee.

title: HMS Queen Elizabeth: On board the Royal Navy's new aircraft carrier
description: For the first time, both British and American jets launch off HMS Queen Elizabeth.

title: India's new paper Covid-19 test could be a ‘game changer’
description: The test, named after a famous Indian fictional detective, is based on gene-editing technology called Crispr.

title: French Open 2020: Rafael Nadal sees off qualifier Sebastian Korda
description: Rafael Nadal races into the quarter-finals with a demolition of American qualifier Sebastian Korda at Roland Garros.

title: Trump's White House event in focus over Covid spread
description: At least eight people who attended a crowded Rose Garden event last Saturday have tested positive.

title: Cineworld to shut down UK screens after Bond film delay
description: The cinema chain says it will have to temporarily close following delays to big-budget film releases.

title: Heavy rain brings flooding and travel disruption
description: Flood warnings are in place after some areas see a month of rainfall in less than two days.

title: Nagorno-Karabakh conflict: Major cities hit as heavy fighting continues
description: Both Azerbaijan's second city and the capital of the breakaway region come under heavy fire.

title: London Marathon: Shura Kitata wins the men's race after amazing sprint, Eliud Kipchoge finishes eighth
description: Ethiopia's Shura Kitata wins the men's race at the London Marathon with a time of two hours five minutes and 41 seconds, after an incredible sprint to the finish line, while Eliud Kipchoge finishes eighth.

title: Covid: Things 'bumpy to Christmas and beyond' - PM
description: Boris Johnson says there is "hope" in fighting the virus, but it could be "a very tough winter".

title: Royal Opera House to sell Hockney portrait to raise funds
description: The institution says selling a portrait of its former boss is a "tough call" but could raise up to £18m.

title: Trump says he is doing well, but next couple of days the 'real test'
description: The president says he is "much better" but his doctors say he is "not out of the woods yet" on Covid.

title: Nagorno-Karabakh conflict: Civilians and BBC team flee shelling
description: Jonah Fisher reports on the Nagorno-Karabakh conflict, where people are "under attack day and night".

title: Top seed Halep thrashed by Polish teenager Swiatek and out of French Open
description: Top seed Simona Halep is out of the French Open after losing to Iga Swiatek in little more than an hour in the fourth round.

title: Patel to promise 'overhaul' of broken' UK asylum system
description: The home secretary will tell the Conservative Party conference the system is "fundamentally broken".

title: The shy girl in the playground who became Scotland's first black female captain
description: Former Scotland defender and Great Britain Olympian Ifeoma Dieke speaks to BBC Scotland during Black History Month.

title: Hall sprints to thrilling second-placed finish
description: Brigid Kosgei defends her London Marathon title with a time of two hours 18 minutes and 58 seconds - while the USA's Sara Hall comes through in a thrilling sprint finish to take second place.

title: President's doctor 'extremely happy' with progress
description: Physicians looking after Donald Trump said they were "cautiously optimistic, but he's doing great".

title: Trump's Covid contact: Who he met and who's tested positive
description: President Donald Trump attended multiple large events in the days before his coronavirus diagnosis.

title: Covid: UK announces 12,872 new cases after technical glitch
description: The 12,872 Covid cases are recorded, but a "technical issue" is blamed for the high figure.

title: The marathon runner doctors thought might spend his life in a wheelchair
description: Michael Beynon is the first person with Down's Syndrome from Wales to complete the run.

title: The Papers: Trump 'given oxygen' and 'radical new drugs'
description: Many of Sunday's front pages focus on US President Donald Trump's health, after his Covid diagnosis.

title: Stumble, the one-legged duck given wheelchair
description: Stumble the duck lost a leg in an accident with a fishing line. But he is not one of life's quitters.

title: In Pictures: Trump supporters hold rallies for the president
description: Supporters gathered outside Walter Reed National Military Hospital and elsewhere on Saturday.

title: Shuttered by Covid: The end of Dagenham Sunday Market
description: Thousands of people flocked to Dagenham Sunday Market every weekend until coronavirus shut it down.

title: 'We sprang Grandma from the care home'
description: Rita Perrott went into a care home, but then visiting was curtailed. Her family didn't want her to die alone.

title: Trump's video message from hospital
description: President Trump says "I'm starting to feel good," a day after being taken to hospital.

title: Covid: 'Upsurge' in giant veg growing during lockdown
description: Shows have adapted during the pandemic to allow growers to display their enormous produce.
